This vignette explains how to use margaret with an example.

```{r eval = FALSE}
library(margaret)

# Load data in a dataframe of r
groups <- read.csv(".../groups_information.csv", header=T, sep=",")

margaret_data <- getting_data(groups)

# Or just
margaret::getting_data(groups)
```
